CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 2, 1961, pg. 1, reads: "Negro Santa Claus - Homewood Chamber of Commerce, in selecting its 1961 Santa Claus, chose a Negro, Joseph Watts, retired city fire captain. Watts, who arrived by helicopter last Friday and was 'rescued' by firemen from the roof of Murphy's Five and Ten Cent Store, will reign during the Christmas season in integrated community.  Lawrence Priestly, Chamber president, is shown welcoming Santa Claus, together with youngsters of the community. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Children and adults gathered around Joseph Watts dressed as Santa Claus, with Lawrence Priestly standing next to him, outside G. C. Murphy's store, Homewood
